alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 30 at 12:01PM CDT until March 30 at 12:30PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Vernon Parish in west central Louisiana... * Until 1230 PM CDT. * At 1200 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Hornbeck, or near Anacoco, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Kurthwood around 1215 PM CDT. Hutton around 1230 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Simpson. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
